# Explore the Epigenome

## Launch the Genome Browser Gateway

Go to [https://genome.ucsc.edu/cgi-bin/hgGateway](https://genome.ucsc.edu/cgi-bin/hgGateway). The landing page looks like this. "Human" is selected by default under "Browse/Select Species".  

```{r, fig.align='center', echo = FALSE, fig.alt= "Landing page for the UCSC Genome browser Gateway"}
ottrpal::include_slide("https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1B7y_jm8GuHZMUvTU1TFdW4nqQQV6nOT9XuFwgSflXz4/edit#slide=id.g15625333d53_0_2")
```

You will be working from the Human Assembly March 2006 (NCBI/hg18) assembly. Make sure this is selected under the "Find Position" dropdown menu.

```{r, fig.align='center', echo = FALSE, fig.alt= "Landing page for the UCSC Genome browser Gateway"}
ottrpal::include_slide("https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1B7y_jm8GuHZMUvTU1TFdW4nqQQV6nOT9XuFwgSflXz4/edit#slide=id.g15625333d53_0_7")
```
